programme.desc: The Dog That Rocks the Cradle: Martin returns from his friend's funeral upset by how it was conducted. Frasier assures his father that all will be well when his time comes.

programme.desc: Sideshow Bob Roberts: Sideshow Bob gets out of prison and stands for Mayor of Springfield, intent on getting revenge on Bart.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer Badman: The babysitter accuses Homer of sexual harassment when he tries to pick a sweet off the back of her trousers. His only hope is Groundskeeper Willie's video camera.

programme.desc: A new series from Queen's in Nottingham. Ronalds has sliced through his ankle at work. Owen's put his shoulder out. Jeremy's bike crash leads to a shocking discovery.

programme.desc: Leapin' Lizards: Station boss Kate doesn't object to the pranks that Bulldog plays on Frasier, despite Dr Crane's obvious discomfort.

programme.desc: (2012) Quirky animated family comedy with the voices of Adam Sandler and Selena Gomez. Count Dracula runs a secluded hotel as a haven for monsters, but his daughter wants to see the world.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Toast Derivation: Sheldon is surprised and disturbed to find out that it's really Leonard who is at the centre of their group of friends and not him.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Prestidigitation Approximation: Leonard must choose between his new girlfriend Priya and his friendship with Penny. Howard drives Sheldon crazy with a magic trick.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Zarnecki Incursion: When somebody hacks into Sheldon's online gaming account, he and his friends become determined to locate the culprit.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Herb Garden Germination: Sheldon and Amy experiment on their friends by spreading gossip, while Howard takes a big step in his relationship with Bernadette.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Agreement Dissection: Priya uses her legal expertise to dissect the roommate agreement and put Sheldon in his place, and the girls take Sheldon dancing.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Wildebeest Implementation: Raj attempts to overcome his anxiety about talking to women, while Penny uses Bernadette to spy on Leonard and his girlfriend.

programme.title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
programme.desc: (1992) Family comedy. Macaulay Culkin ends up in a swish New York hotel while his family are in Miami. But the burglars he defeated before (Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern) are back...

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: The celebrity Goggleboxers, including Rylan and Mo Gilligan, watch MILF Manor, Under Paris, Bake Off: The Professionals, The Supervet, Countdown and The Motorway Hotel.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch Trigger Point, One Day, Married at First Sight Australia, Sort Your Life Out, Into the Congo with Ben Fogle, Earthsounds and This Morning.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch The Gentlemen, Casualty, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?, Crufts, Queens, Martin Compston's Norwegian Fling and ITV News(Princess of Wales).

programme.title: First Dates Valentine's
programme.desc: It's Valentine's night, but 'clubbing queen' Amanda's looking for a guy who's not too romantic or keen too soon. And can businessman Brendan finally find love after almost 1000 dates?

programme.title: First Dates: Valentine's
programme.desc: There are extra portions of romance in a Valentine's special at the First Dates restaurant - for broken-hearted Chris, singer twins Hazel and Brenda, and flirty Saskia and Roisin.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch Trigger Point, One Day, Married at First Sight Australia, Sort Your Life Out, Into the Congo with Ben Fogle, Earthsounds and This Morning.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers watch The Gentlemen, Casualty, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?, Crufts, Queens, Martin Compston's Norwegian Fling and ITV News(Princess of Wales).

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Peter's: Gordon visits Peter's Italian Restaurant in New York, where the peace of Long Island is shattered by the antics of the volatile Pellegrino family who run the place.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: The One with the Leak: Yanis wants his big day to be a towering success, featuring the Eiffel Tower.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Protestors fill the police station after a villager is wrongfully imprisoned. Tony and Diane try to help Ro, who's in danger of turning to old habits. And an anniversary doesn't go to plan.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Shopping: Erica's new job at a department store is put in jeopardy when Beverly takes advantage of her daughter's employee discount far too frequently.

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: The One with the Leak: Yanis wants his big day to be a towering success, featuring the Eiffel Tower.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Levanti's: Gordon visits Pennsylvania, where he meets siblings whose inability to work together is risking their father's life savings at his Italian restaurant, Levanti's.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room: In California, Gordon visits Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room, where he tries to mend relationships between the owner, his wife and their children.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon visits Peter's Italian Restaurant in New York, where the peace of Long Island is regularly shattered by the antics of the volatile Pellegrino family who run the place.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Engagement Reaction: Howard finally tells his mother that he's engaged to Bernadette. Unfortunately, the news lands his mum in hospital.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Roommate Transmogrification: Raj decides to move in with Sheldon after hearing Leonard and Priya engaging in a Star Trek bedroom fantasy.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Skank Reflex Analysis: Penny worries that she's screwed things up with her friends after her night with Raj. Sheldon takes command of the paintball team.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Infestation Hypothesis: Amy is stuck in the middle of a battle of wills between Penny and Sheldon. Leonard and Priya try to spice up their long-distance relationship.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2
programme.desc: (2015) Animated family comedy sequel. Mavis (Selena Gomez) and Johnny (Andy Samberg) leave baby Dennis with 'Vampa' Dracula (Adam Sandler), who organises a monster boot camp.

programme.title: Home Alone 3
programme.desc: (1997) Comedy sequel starring Alex D. Linz as a resourceful boy who's stranded at home with chickenpox when a top-secret military microchip comes his way. Can he keep it safe from crooks?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Dangerous Curves: Homer and Marge head to a log cabin for the weekend and reminisce about their early courtship.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Lisa Exchange Cross Words: Lisa discovers that she has a knack for crosswords and enters a tournament. But Homer thinks he can make money by betting on Lisa to lose.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mypods and Broomsticks: Homer suspects that Bart's new friend's Muslim family are terrorists. Meanwhile, Lisa becomes addicted to downloading songs on her new Mypod.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Burns and the Bees: Mr Burns wins a basketball team in a game of poker, then decides to build a stadium on top of Lisa's bee colony.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Treehouse of Horror XIX: Halloween special. Homer comes up against a murderous rigged voting machine. Lisa's Malibu Stacy car and a vengeful giant pumpkin get a bit deadly too.

programme.title: New: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brand new series - The Dad-Feelings Limited: New episodes come to E4. As Comic Book Guy and his wife Kumiko debate whether to have a baby, his awesome origin story is revealed.

programme.title: New: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brand new series - Diary Queen: New episodes of The Simpsons come to E4. Bart finds his old teacher's diary and learns a surprising secret. Then Lisa discovers a bigger surprise.

programme.title: Little Fockers
programme.desc: (2010) Comedy sequel with Robert De Niro, Ben Stiller and Jessica Alba. Can Greg Focker live up to nightmare dad-in-law Jack's newfound reluctant sort-of respect?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the 'Box this time, Get Organized with The Home Edit, Ratched, EastEnders, Yorkshire Tea vs PG Tips: Battle of the Brews, The Third Day and The Great British Bake Off.

programme.title: Walking and Talking
programme.desc: (1996) Comedy with Catherine Keener and Anne Heche. A successful woman's best friend is getting married - making her feel unlucky in love. But is everything as rosy as it at first seems?

programme.title: The Square
programme.desc: (2017) Artworld satire starring Claes Bang as a shallow museum director setting up an exhibition that's supposedly about altruism. With Elisabeth Moss.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Anzio
programme.desc: (1968) Epic Second World War drama starring Robert Mitchum. A reporter gets trapped behind enemy lines during the costly 1944 Allied invasion of Italy. With Peter Falk and Robert Ryan.

programme.title: The Seventh Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: (1958) Fantasy adventure. When Sinbad's fiance is shrunk by an evil magician, he must overcome a series of daunting adversaries and obstacles to restore her. Effects by Ray Harryhausen.

programme.title: An Affair to Remember
programme.desc: (1957) Cary Grant and Deborah Kerr star as a couple who meet on a transatlantic voyage and fall in love. But they are both engaged to another - will their love survive the test of time?

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: (1995) Classic 90s high-school re-imagining of Jane Austen's Emma. Two fashion-obsessed pals (Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash) transform a new girl (Brittany Murphy) but create a monster.

programme.title: 13 Going on 30
programme.desc: (2004) Breezy body-swap romcom. Following a disastrous birthday party, teen Jenna wishes she was '30, flirty and thriving'. And boom, she's Jennifer Garner with a fancy flat and a cool job.

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: (1999) Hugh Grant and Julia Roberts star in the hugely popular comedy romance about a lowly bookshop owner who manages to get a glamorous movie star to go out with him. With Rhys Ifans.

programme.title: Three Thousand Years of Longing
programme.desc: (2022) Fantasy with Idris Elba and Tilda Swinton. A djinn offers a storytelling expert three wishes. But she knows to look this gift horse in the mouth and so makes it all about him.

programme.title: Rita, Sue and Bob Too
programme.desc: (1987) Alan Clarke's celebrated drama frankly and uninhibitedly embodies the social and cultural attitudes of the era. A feckless husband can't resist his two teenage babysitters.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Dunston Checks In
programme.desc: (1996) Comedy starring Faye Dunaway and Rupert Everett. A hotel owner's attempt to upgrade her star rating is undermined by the arrival of a master thief and his light-fingered orangutan.

programme.title: The Golden Child
programme.desc: (1986) All-action comedy. Can a private eye (Eddie Murphy) track down the peace-bringing Golden Child, who's been kidnapped from a Tibetan temple?

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: (1992) Comedy starring Whoopi Goldberg. A casino singer who witnesses a Mob murder goes into hiding at a convent, where she soon has the choir rocking. With Maggie Smith.

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: (1993) Comedy sequel starring Whoopi Goldberg and Lauryn Hill. Deloris - who's now made it big in Vegas - goes back undercover as a teacher to help a struggling school choir find its voice.

programme.title: We Live in Time Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Andrew Garfield and Florence Pugh - along with director John Crowley - talk about making the Film4-backed romantic drama We Live in Time.

programme.title: Daddy's Home 2
programme.desc: (2017) Comedy sequel with Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg, Mel Gibson and John Lithgow. There's trouble in store for the extended family when Dusty and Brad's fathers visit for Christmas.

programme.title: Ad Astra
programme.desc: (2019) Visually stunning sci-fi starring Brad Pitt as a famously cool astronaut sent to the edges of the solar system to save Earth from deadly power surges. With Tommy Lee Jones.

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: (2018) Tense horror starring John Krasinski and Emily Blunt. A family struggle to survive when the world's overrun by vicious blind aliens who can hear even the slightest whimper.

programme.title: A.I. Artificial Intelligence
programme.desc: (2001) Steven Spielberg's science-fiction Pinocchio. After their real son miraculously recovers from a rare disease, the childlike android a couple adopted sets out to become a real boy.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Stardust
programme.desc: (2007) Magical family fantasy with Charlie Cox, Sienna Miller, Claire Danes and Robert De Niro. A man must enter a dangerous, mystical world to capture a fallen star for his beloved.

programme.title: Rango
programme.desc: (2011) Animated Wild West comedy with Johnny Depp. A pet chameleon accidentally becomes the sheriff of small frontier town, Dirt. Can he defend it? Oh, and he's got a mate called Roadkill.

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: (2007) Action adventure. Shia LaBeouf gets caught up in a battle between two groups of violent shape-shifting robots, one of which - the Decepticons - is out to destroy humanity.

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom...
programme.desc: ...of the Crystal Skull: (2008) Steven Spielberg's action adventure with Harrison Ford and Cate Blanchett. Indy must stop the KGB from gaining the power held in the lost city of Eldorado.

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: (1996) Blockbusting landmark sci-fi action-thriller starring Will Smith and Jeff Goldblum. A US Air Force pilot and a scientist battle aliens who are spectacularly destroying our planet.

programme.title: Bad Boys II
programme.desc: (2003) Action-comedy sequel starring Will Smith and Martin Lawrence as Detectives Lowrey and Burnett. The pair investigate a Cuban drug lord controlling the flow of ecstasy into Miami.

programme.title: Crush
programme.desc: (2022) Romcom with Rowan Blanchard. When a high-school artist is accused of being Banksy-wannabe 'King Pun', she must clear her name. She's even forced to join the track team. #sonotcool.

programme.title: Walking and Talking
programme.desc: (1996) Comedy with Catherine Keener and Anne Heche. A successful woman's best friend is getting married - making her feel unlucky in love. But is everything as rosy as it at first seems?

programme.title: The Square
programme.desc: (2017) Artworld satire starring Claes Bang as a shallow museum director setting up an exhibition that's supposedly about altruism. With Elisabeth Moss.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson hosts from Newark Showground in Nottinghamshire as sellers aim to get cash offers from dealers for their collectables and antiques or gamble to make more at auction. Pam makes 50 times more than she paid for her 19th-century Japanese vases, a mystery medallion has everyone guessing, and Julie gets a huge surprise when Tracy Thackray-Howitt pays her thousands for her mum's rings

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Playing to beat the reigning champions are sisters Olami and Ito and mother and daughter Pam and Enya from Coventry. Adil Ray hosts

programme.title: Deal or No Deal

programme.title: The Chase

programme.title: What's on Scotland

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: A flashforward to later that night centres on a frozen lake, and chaos as the groups head to their respective limousines. There are two crashes as both cars swerve off the road

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Andy outlines details of the robbery to an uneasy David, Carla fears that Rob will back out of the operation, and Kevin shares his test results with Jack. Cassie is given the green light to pursue Steve, Gemma arranges to introduce Chesney to her new pal, and single Leanne drowns her sorrows

programme.title: Connecting a Killer: True Crime Presents
programme.desc: When Special Investigating Officer Steve Wilkins is shocked at a series of unsolved crimes in his hometown, he is given permission to launch a new operation to review all the evidence

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a celebrity version of the big-prize quiz in which Julie Hesmondhalgh and Tony Bellew answer questions to win cash for their chosen charities. With lifelines including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts the game in which Daniella and Charlotte from London and Nathan and Aarati from Kent take on the reigning Lingo champions and use their skills to find words from the fewest letters possible. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to potentially double the money they won earlier or leave with nothing

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Join Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern for the most dramatic show yet with the return of the skate-off and the bottom two couples battling it out to avoid elimination.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team are in Raunds, Northamptonshire, to overhaul firefighter Rebecca's garden, creating a space that can accommodate gym equipment, a play area and a vegetable patch. Meanwhile, Danny Clarke pays a visit to Easton Lodge in Essex where designer Harold Peto also created garden rooms to play in, relax and grow vegetables, but on a much bigger scale

programme.title: Judi Love's Culinary Cruise
programme.desc: The comedian embarks on a culinary adventure aboard a luxury yacht, visiting fabulous locations and finding out all about local heritage and traditions, taking in the culture and incredible produce. Judi's first stop is Kotor in Montenegro, which is famous for its seafood, where she is given a tour of the historic town by local resident Doloris, and visits an oyster and mussel farm

programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and serving up a couple of mouth-watering dishes for comedian Dave Gorman while also enjoying recipes from chefs Atul Kochhar and John Williams and forager Alysia Vasey

programme.title: Nisha Katona's Home Kitchen
programme.desc: The restaurateur cooks a chicken korma approved by her auntie, an Eastern European clear vegetable soup with dumplings nicknamed 'little sparrows', and a barbecued tandoori monkfish tail while she looks for genuine Indian furniture for a new eatery

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Ascot
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of a meeting headlined by the Ascot Chase, plus the Kingwell Hurdle from Wincanton and the Grand National Trial at Haydock Park. Analysis is from Mick Fitzgerald and Tom Scudamore, with commentary by Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune

programme.title: Ainsley's National Trust Cook Off
programme.desc: Chefs compete to make the best alfresco dishes at stately homes, with Ainsley Harriott challenging them to come up with recipes inspired by their surroundings. In the opening edition, he is joined by Poppy O'Toole and Sam Grainger at the Wimpole Estate in Cambridgeshire, where Ainsley also gets to meet staff and volunteers to find out about the work and effort that goes into maintaining the kitchen garden

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the grand final of the singing contest as the finalists are joined by three previous singers for one-of-a-kind duets as they compete to be crowned champion by judging panel Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Maya Jama and special guest Danny Jones

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by star of Gavin & Stacey Joanna Page, sports presenter and host of The High Performance Podcast Jake Humphrey, and India Hicks. Farmer Tom Davis brings along a pair of piglets to hog the limelight, and drinks expert Andy Clarke shares his favourite tipples inspired by the movies in the Best of British feature

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: Kelvin is in the market for a bull in his mission to expand the cow herd and Marnie checks in on her Jacob's sheep, with plans to put the tup in soon as she plans ahead for lambing season. Milo, Kelvin and his dad start to work on an old vintage tractor that they bought for the twins in a second-hand sale, and the Fletchers celebrate another successful year on the farm by inviting all their friends over to say thank you

programme.title: The Royal Beat
programme.desc: Kate Thornton is joined by ITV News Royal Editor Chris Ship, Vanity Fair's Royal Correspondent Katie Nicholl, and royal commentator Afua Hagan to discuss all of the latest news surrounding the royal family

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Christmas special of the detective drama from 2016. The village of Little Auburn has stood abandoned since the Second World War, but now plans are afoot to restore it to its former glory via three competing projects. It is left to local landowner Roderick Craven to determine which scheme will win out, but on the eve of his big decision, one of the project leaders is murdered. DCI Barnaby and his new partner DS Jamie Winter are soon on the case, and when death stalks the streets of Little Auburn again, Barnaby and Winter are dragged into a web of conspiracy involving fraud, deadly snakes, and Roderick's estranged brother, Milo (guest star Hugh Dennis). Neil Dudgeon stars, with Nick Hendrix making his debut as Barnaby's latest assistant

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts as Richard Madeley, Sheila Ferguson and Mark Wright answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Cherry Healey, Dallas Campbell, Ria Hebden and Robert Peston pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Inside China: The Battle for Tibet
programme.desc: Investigating the mystery of a missing boy, the 11th Panchen Lama, who was abducted by Beijing 30 years ago whose role now holds the key to the Dalai Lama's successor and to Tibet's future. Using ground-breaking footage, testimony and interviews with recent Tibetan escapees, this documentary reveals the restrictions Tibetans face daily under Chinese President Xi Jinping's rule and sees how the unique culture of seven million Tibetans is being wiped away

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the grand final of the singing contest as the finalists are joined by three previous singers for one-of-a-kind duets as they compete to be crowned champion by judging panel Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Maya Jama and special guest Danny Jones

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by star of Gavin & Stacey Joanna Page, sports presenter and host of The High Performance Podcast Jake Humphrey, and India Hicks. Farmer Tom Davis brings along a pair of piglets to hog the limelight, and drinks expert Andy Clarke shares his favourite tipples inspired by the movies in the Best of British feature

programme.title: Fletchers' Family Farm
programme.desc: Kelvin is in the market for a bull in his mission to expand the cow herd and Marnie checks in on her Jacob's sheep, with plans to put the tup in soon as she plans ahead for lambing season. Milo, Kelvin and his dad start to work on an old vintage tractor that they bought for the twins in a second-hand sale, and the Fletchers celebrate another successful year on the farm by inviting all their friends over to say thank you

programme.title: The Royal Beat
programme.desc: Kate Thornton is joined by ITV News Royal Editor Chris Ship, Vanity Fair's Royal Correspondent Katie Nicholl, and royal commentator Afua Hagan to discuss all of the latest news surrounding the royal family

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Christmas special of the detective drama from 2016. The village of Little Auburn has stood abandoned since the Second World War, but now plans are afoot to restore it to its former glory via three competing projects. It is left to local landowner Roderick Craven to determine which scheme will win out, but on the eve of his big decision, one of the project leaders is murdered. DCI Barnaby and his new partner DS Jamie Winter are soon on the case, and when death stalks the streets of Little Auburn again, Barnaby and Winter are dragged into a web of conspiracy involving fraud, deadly snakes, and Roderick's estranged brother, Milo (guest star Hugh Dennis). Neil Dudgeon stars, with Nick Hendrix making his debut as Barnaby's latest assistant

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts as Richard Madeley, Sheila Ferguson and Mark Wright answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Cherry Healey, Dallas Campbell, Ria Hebden and Robert Peston pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Holly Willoughby and Stephen Mulhern host as the remaining six couples are split into two teams for 80s week and with extra points on offer, everyone is trying to avoid the skate off

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a celebrity version of the big-prize quiz in which Steph McGovern and Dion Dublin answer questions to win cash for their chosen charities. With lifelines including Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck

programme.title: Inside China: The Battle for Tibet
programme.desc: Investigating the mystery of a missing boy, the 11th Panchen Lama, who was abducted by Beijing 30 years ago whose role now holds the key to the Dalai Lama's successor and to Tibet's future. Using ground-breaking footage, testimony and interviews with recent Tibetan escapees, this documentary reveals the restrictions Tibetans face daily under Chinese President Xi Jinping's rule and sees how the unique culture of seven million Tibetans is being wiped away

programme.desc: Musical comedy starring Anna Kendrick and Rebel Wilson. Having been forcibly disbanded for disgracing themselves, a cappella group the Barden Bellas discover a get-out clause - all they have to do is win an international singing competition in Copenhagen.

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: Coronation Street

programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Christmas special of the detective drama from 2016. The village of Little Auburn has stood abandoned since the Second World War, but now plans are afoot to restore it to its former glory via three competing projects. It is left to local landowner Roderick Craven to determine which scheme will win out, but on the eve of his big decision, one of the project leaders is murdered. DCI Barnaby and his new partner DS Jamie Winter are soon on the case, and when death stalks the streets of Little Auburn again, Barnaby and Winter are dragged into a web of conspiracy involving fraud, deadly snakes, and Roderick's estranged brother, Milo (guest star Hugh Dennis). Neil Dudgeon stars, with Nick Hendrix making his debut as Barnaby's latest assistant

programme.desc: Investigating the mystery of a missing boy, the 11th Panchen Lama, who was abducted by Beijing 30 years ago whose role now holds the key to the Dalai Lama's successor and to Tibet's future. Using ground-breaking footage, testimony and interviews with recent Tibetan escapees, this documentary reveals the restrictions Tibetans face daily under Chinese President Xi Jinping's rule and sees how the unique culture of seven million Tibetans is being wiped away
